channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8299994] java/security/Policy/Root/Root.java fails when home directory is read-only
item.description:
The following test fails in the JDK21 CI:

java/security/Policy/Root/Root.java

Heres a snippet from the log file:

#section:testng
----------messages:(6/219)----------
command: testng Root
reason: User specified action: run testng/othervm Root
started: Wed Jan 11 19:56:10 GMT 2023
Mode: othervm [/othervm specified]
finished: Wed Jan 11 19:56:10 GMT 2023
elapsed time (seconds): 0.887
----------configuration:(0/0)----------
----------System.out:(80/5227)----------
config Root.setup(): failure
java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException: /opt/mach5/.java.policy

item.summary: java/security/Policy/Root/Root.java fails when home directory is read-only

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/3104
Date: 2024-12-09 13:43:22 +0000

Fix request [17u]

I backport this for parity with 17.0.13-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
Resolved ProblemList
Test does the expected. SAP nighlty testing passed.

Changeset: 20579e48
Author: Bill Huang <bhuang@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-02-03 19:19:14 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/20579e48cf598e890aa35c5518ec8d0594f45385

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/12354
Date: 2023-01-31 22:35:21 +0000

Changing from [~mikael] to [~bhuang] since this bug is likely due
to a problem in the test itself.

This test was recently modified by the following bug fix:

    JDK-8295087 Manual Test to Automated Test Conversion

In any case, it is strange for a test to create/modify a file in the
home directory of the user.

I do have to wonder why the test is trying to create a file here:

java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException: /opt/mach5/.java.policy

/opt/mach5 shouldn't be touch by test code...

[~mikael] - I really don't see the connection between this failure mode and the fix for:

JDK-8299918 Update Xcode11.3.1-MacOSX10.15 devkit at Oracle

but jdk-21+5-268-tier2 only contains one new changeset and that's the one for JDK-8299918.

Update: See [~tbell]'s comments below...
